Description: Wooden comb, lentoid in section with coarse teeth on one side and fine teeth on the other. There is a single decorative motif of 4 concentric circles on each face of the handle. At a later date the fine teeth have been removed and a hole pierced through to allow the object to be suspended.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), House LC1-4 fill
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
